Posts.Content: Hooraayyy!!!!!
Posts.Title: laughs a lot's test is ok

Posts.Content: Dawne, My radiologist said he was surprised that I didn't really burn because I was fair-skinned. Now I did get red enough at the end that I started peeling, but it was like a sunburn. Also, my doctor gave me a prescription for cream that was very good.
Posts.Title: Finally started rads today

Posts.Content: My personal opinion is that I would have a yearly mammogram. I'm 60 now and I started annual mammograms in my 30's. I think it's important for you to be vigilent when cancer is in your family. As far as self-exam--do that, but what you'll be able to catch with that is something that's fairly large if you have no other symptoms. I'm like you; I was always so lumpy I couldn't tell if I had a problem or not. That was until I found a lump in my right breast. Be in tune to your body; if you feel something is wrong take the time to go to your physician. By doing all the above you should be able to feel pretty certain that you are ok. hugs, Judy
Posts.Title: How do you know?

Posts.Content: Kya- My toenail didn't come completely off, but if I'd had one more treatment I think it would have. It was my big toenail. I'm now trying to "save" since my treatment is over. A foot doctor might be able to give you some relief.
Posts.Title: Toenail

Posts.Content: I'm so sorry for what you're facing, but give your husband a pat on the back from me. He is what all of us in the "boat" need. Lots of positive thoughts coming your way.... Judy
Posts.Title: Hubby was good today....

Posts.Content: I'm just going to share my opinion. I think we need someone we can share our fears with, so I hope you have someone for that. I discovered that my oncologist talked very quickly and matter-of-factly while I was panicking after her first sentence. I found that her nurse was easy to talk to. I also wrote down everything I wanted to ask and, again, the nurse answered most of the questions. Maybe he didn't literally mean you have cancer in your body now, but that the cancer cells can be other places in the body undetected which can lead to a recurrence. The way it was explained to me was that the chemo would kill quickly growing cells which is what the cancer does, so undeteced cells would be zapped. On the other hand, you may want another opinion or to switch oncologists for one that might make you feel more comfortable. I will pray for you and keep us posted on how this goes... sending positive thoughts your way--Judy
Posts.Title: My Chemo Drugs??

Posts.Content: Oh man, Debbie--I am so sorry. You have my prayers and positive thoughts coming your way. The Mayo is supposed to be one of the best hospitals anywhere for cancer.
Posts.Title: Pink Gloves On - Back in the ring for Round 3!!

Posts.Content: Right now I'm having mammograms on the breast that's left every six months. I see my oncologist again in July and she had said we would do a lung x-ray. She seems to think that's where I might have a recurrence. Frankly, it wouldn't bother me to have tests a lot more often because of the worry.
Posts.Title: Pet Scan info

Posts.Content: Oh man, Debbie--I am so sorry. You have my prayers and positive thoughts coming your way. The Mayo is supposed to be one of the best hospitals anywhere for cancer.
Posts.Title: Pink Gloves On - Back in the ring for Round 3!!

Posts.Content: How do you get to your expressions page? Judy
Posts.Title: I found a pink dump truck

Posts.Content: I found it and I love it! Judy
Posts.Title: I found a pink dump truck

Posts.Content: I took Xeloda during my radiation. Remember that a Stage 4 diagnosis doesn't mean there is nothing that can be done. I have talked with many people on these sites who had that diagnosis, and they are doing great, long-term My prayers are with you. Judy
Posts.Title: Next step in my journey

Posts.Content: Mariam,\ We are all in this together. After I was diagnosed with cancer I really wanted everything removed that could be. That didn't happen, so I worry off and on about my lower extremities. Childre are so difficul sometimes, and they don't understand when you don't feel your best. I will be thinking about you, and if that doctor is not a fit for you, by all means change to someone who can comfort you while treating you.
Posts.Title: finding things a little difficult - acupuncture update

Posts.Content: Both are great. I especially like the one on attitude.
Posts.Title: Attitude (e-mail from my mom)

Posts.Content: Bless you, Jayne. I am so sorry about this diagnosis. People here will listen and answer questions for you. Of course once you get over this shock, you can begin to piece things together. While this isn't good, it may not be as bad as you think right now. Our minds head to the darkest places first. Vent all you want and know that my prayers and others will be with you.
Posts.Title: Leukemia now breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hey--I'm just 4'10" so my arms are short, but I'm stretching them as far as they will go to encircle everyone here........
Posts.Title: GROUP HUG time!

Posts.Content: I think I would have enjoyed having that. My eyebrows and eyelashes have grown back. If yours came out because of the chemo, yours may come back too. However, if it makes YOU happy and it makes you feel good, I think it's a go!!! (PS-I have two tattoes--I got them when I was young and didn't know any better--I was in my 40's) and that's another good story......
Posts.Title: Permanent makeup - a vanity issue

Posts.Content: My oncologist said that radiation would kill any cancer cells that might be in the area where they removed my breast. I don't know if that's what has happened, but I was willing to do anything and radiation is a walk in the park compared to chemo.
Posts.Title: Does radiation make sense when you have already gotten chemo?

Posts.Content: I'm not sure how radiation is with implants, but without them it's not too bad. The area on my chest where they beamed the light got red like it was sunburned. Then right at the end the reddest area began to peel. They gave me a cream I used and it wasn't that uncomfortable. They do say fatigue goes with it, but I couldn' tell much difference.
Posts.Title: I had surgery on June 10th & thank you all for the best wishes!

Posts.Content: Thanks for the beautiful words.
Posts.Title: a prayer for all

Posts.Content: I know how you feel. My husband had a physician at the same office, and I had a different one. The one I had just didn't take me seriously. I thought he acted like I was making things up. So I switched to the doctor my husband was using. Boy did I feel awkward for a while, but we have to take charge sometimes and do what will be best for us in the long run. Hugs, Judy
Posts.Title: I'm so discouraged

Posts.Content: I had Xeloda with raiation. The radiologist told me that the site of my radiation might get redder quicker with the xeloda. I didn't have any other side-effects as far as I know. I mean, the radiation makes you tired and I don't know if xeloda added to that. But, I still got up and did what I wanted to. I wasn't just wiped out and bed-ridden or anything. Judy
Posts.Title: Starting xeloda with radiation - any experiences?

Posts.Content: Thank you. I read all I can on what's new for our cancer. Judy
Posts.Title: Different Subtypes of Triple-Negative Breast Cancer Respond to Different Therapies

Posts.Content: Hi Sue. I had a mascetomy in Sept. 0f 2010; I did not have any reconstruction. November 22 I will have my other breast removed and I don't want any reconstruction. The surgery is not nearly as bad as I had imagined it. I will say extra prayers for you tonight. Hugs, Judy
Posts.Title: Would love support and words of encouragement.....

Posts.Content: I so sorry your pet died. It can be so devastating to lose one. They become our family! Judy
Posts.Title: OT Iguana Story
